title: shanhaigamefi
author: shanhaigamefi
content: I came across a tragic story. The protagonist of the story was looking for an alternative to PayPal in July 2010. He found BTC. At that time, the price of BTC was 10 cents,but no one bought it.Like many unfortunate stories, he put it aside, and then forgot about it until it appeared in the media in 2013.

The year had bitcoin going from high price to low price but it was still relatively low compared to now.Even though that protagonist started paying attention to bitcoin when it had already hit a hundred dollars, that’s still better than finding bitcoin when it’s worth a whole house (at least in my country)

comments.author: SAHASAN
comments.body: Maximum people found bitcoin in 2nd or 3rd time.My first bitcoin buy in 2014 when the price was 400$ per btc but I understand bitcoin as a asset properly in 2017 Bull run.

comments.author: Smack That Ace
comments.body: Too many regret stories related to bitcoin have been discussed and you can search for them on this forum instead of creating a new topic. I don't know how you missed out on bitcoins before, but I know you will continue to regret it even more if you don't own any bitcoins now. Additionally, having regrets and spending time reminiscing about the past will not help you get back the bitcoins you sold or lost. So use that time to collect as many bitcoins as possible, find ways to correct past mistakes, and don't let those regrets repeat themselves 10 years from now.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Bitcoin was a hidden gem during 2009-2010 and the ones who bought it back then or mined it in its early days were the lucky ones. There have been many stories of regret and each one of us regret when we didn't invest in Bitcoin.I found about Bitcoin in 2016 when its price was below $700 but I wasn't sure about it and that's why I didn't invested any money in it. I used it for trading, but I was not sure about holding and that's why I regret that if I had invested around $45k to $60k in Bitcoin back then, now I would most probably a millionaire.But, I'm still thankful that I found about this gem in 2016, and today I don't have any financial issues only because of Bitcoin. Our regrets can be converted in our happiness when we start doing things right from the current moment and forget about the past.

comments.author: criptoevangelista
comments.body: These stories are extremely common, I discovered bitcoin myself in 2011, and like many people did, I also didn't care and didn't buy it.In fact, I had no way of knowing exactly whether it would work or not, it was practically impossible to know that it would appreciate so much. .. Cases of people from that time who kept their bitcoins in hodl until today must be very rare, because if you buy something for 0.10 and that something is worth 10 thousand dollars, it is very difficult not to want to sell.

Of course not. Many did not buy Bitcoin until after 2013, and everyone who owned Bitcoin before that mined it. Therefore, if you had mined Bitcoin for free, then selling it at a price of 1-10 dollars will be good.I sold some Bitcoin at a price of $4,000 and today its price is more than $70,000. It may be $700,000 after several years, and we will see some people saying that if the price of Bitcoin was $70,000, I would have put all my wealth in Bitcoin.

As at them no one would have believe that someday bitcoin would be this expensive untill now. I. comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: shanhaigamefi on April 17, 2024, 08:36:53 AMI came across a tragic story. The protagonist of the story was looking for an alternative to PayPal in July 2010. He found BTC. At that time, the price of BTC was 10 cents,but no one bought it.Like many unfortunate stories, he put it aside and then forgot about it until it appeared in the media in 2013.I won't blame anybody who failed to buy Bitcoin at its early stage because it was a new invention. Before then people knew only fiat, so investing in something strange will be highly unlikely. It will take people who understand blockchain technology and also willing to take risks. Many people carelessly lost their keys, while some sold before the price increased and many more stories. I don't have any regrets about my adventure in the crypto industry because it is still at its infant stage and still holds diverse opportunities. We cannot shape the past but we can take advantage of today's opportunity and plan for the future. We do not just listen or hear about these regretful stories but gain lessons which will help us make the right decisions.

So back during at 2019, I sold 1 whole bitcoins for 9000$. I expected Bitcoins won’t go above this and as I was impatient, hence I made little profit at that time by selling 1 Bitcoin. comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: In my life, I've made some big calls that have paid off and some that didnt. Thats how business works and how life works. But why waste time thinking about "what-ifs"? Thats for people who lose. Did you miss the early days of Bitcoin? Most people did the same thing. Smart play doesnt cry over it; it knows how the game works. Thats the real win: each cycle taught me more about the market and technology. You people worry about lost money, but Im worried about what I've learned. That is how nations are made. I got smarter with every move, good or bad. People who cant see the big picture or change are the ones who feel regret.
